table.feedFormat: ROW FORMAT SERDE 'org.apache.hadoop.hive.serde2.OpenCSVSerde' WITH SERDEPROPERTIES ( 'separatorChar' = ',' ,'escapeChar' = '\\' ,'quoteChar' = '"') STORED AS TEXTFILE

dataTransformation.dataTransformScript:
import org.apache.spark.sql._
var df = sqlContext.sql("SELECT tbl10.`time`, tbl10.`application`, tbl10.`failures_total` FROM `tecnologia__monitoraggio`.`cdc_o_apm` tbl10")
df = df
df = df.select(df("*"), functions.unix_timestamp(functions.trim(df("time")), "dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm").cast("timestamp").as("datetime"))
df = df.drop("time")
df
dataTransformation.sql: SELECT tbl10.`time`, tbl10.`application`, tbl10.`failures_total` FROM `tecnologia__monitoraggio`.`cdc_o_apm` tbl10

userProperties.description: The format of the Dataset, current supported values are json or csv. If specified there will be a validation of the input file, otherwise the file will be ingested as it is.
The type of the Dataset ordinary/standard/derived
The sub domain of the Dataset

relationships.name: set state fail
relationships.description: A failure to set the state after adding the attributes to the FlowFile will route the FlowFile here.

relationships.name: success
relationships.description: All successful FlowFiles are routed to this relationship

properties.metadata.dataTransformation.dataTransfor:
import org.apache.spark.sql._
var df = sqlContext.sql("SELECT tbl10.`time`, tbl10.`application`, tbl10.`failures_total` FROM `tecnologia__monitoraggio`.`cdc_o_apm` tbl10")
df = df
df = df.select(df("*"), functions.unix_timestamp(functions.trim(df("time")), "dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm").cast("timestamp").as("datetime"))
df = df.drop("time")
df

Delete Attributes Expression.name: Delete Attributes Expression
Delete Attributes Expression.description: Regular expression for attributes to be deleted from FlowFiles.  Existing attributes that match will be deleted regardless of whether they are updated by this processor.

Store State.name: Store State
Store State.description: Select whether or not state will be stored. Selecting 'Stateless' will offer the default functionality of purely updating the attributes on a FlowFile in a stateless manner. Selecting a stateful option will not only store the attributes on the FlowFile but also in the Processors state. See the 'Stateful Usage' topic of the 'Additional Details' section of this processor's documentation for more information

Stateful Variables Initial Value.name: Stateful Variables Initial Value
Stateful Variables Initial Value.description: If using state to set/reference variables then this value is used to set the initial value of the stateful variable. This will only be used in the @OnScheduled method when state does not contain a value for the variable. This is required if running statefully but can be empty if needed.

File Size.name: File Size
File Size.description: The size of the file that will be used

Batch Size.name: Batch Size
Batch Size.description: The number of FlowFiles to be transferred in each invocation

Data Format.name: Data Format
Data Format.description: Specifies whether the data should be Text or Binary

Unique FlowFiles.name: Unique FlowFiles
Unique FlowFiles.description: If true, each FlowFile that is generated will be unique. If false, a random value will be generated and all FlowFiles will get the same content but this offers much higher throughput

generate-ff-custom-text.name: generate-ff-custom-text
generate-ff-custom-text.description: If Data Format is text and if Unique FlowFiles is false, then this custom text will be used as content of the generated FlowFiles and the File Size will be ignored. Finally, if Expression Language is used, evaluation will be performed only once per batch of generated FlowFiles

character-set.name: character-set
character-set.description: Specifies the character set to use when writing the bytes of Custom Text to a flow file.
